title: Convenience Radicalism: How Platform Logic Hollowed Out Political Life
excerpt: This essay introduces convenience radicalism — a form of platform-shaped political identity that aestheticizes dissent while structurally disabling collective action.

title: Giedion's Paradox: Administrative Modernization and Interface Capture
excerpt: Giedion’s Paradox explains how modernization hides vulnerability behind efficiency. This piece traces historical and technical patterns that reveal the interface as both mask and weapon.
